title: 107_hr2512
content: Authorization of appropriations for United States Customs Service for enhanced activities along the Southwest border. Authorization of appropriations for enhanced border investigative resources on the Southwest border, including funds for salaries, expenses, and equipment for the United States Customs Service. This includes specific allocations for narcotics enforcement, cargo processing, and counterterrorism technology deployment, such as mobile truck gamma ray systems and high energy pallet gamma ray systems. Authorization of appropriations for enhanced border investigative resources on the Southwest border, including funds for salaries, expenses, and equipment for the United States Customs Service. This includes allocations for various equipment upgrades and maintenance, canine kennel construction, Industry Partnership Programs expansion, and surveillance systems. Authorization of appropriations for enhanced border investigative resources on the Southwest border includes funds for various equipment upgrades such as land border vehicle targeting systems, under vehicle inspection systems, outbound passenger facilities, work station replacements, Customs Automated Operations System lane installations, explosive vapor trace detectors, radiation pager detectors, radiation identification devices, and radiation and explosive detection training. Additionally, funds are allocated for maintenance and support of the equipment and training of personnel. The Commissioner of Customs can use authorized funds for technologically superior equipment that achieves the same results at a lower cost than specified equipment. Funds can also be reallocated for equipment upgrades within a 10% limit. In fiscal years 2002 and 2003, $79,000,000 and $172,000,000 respectively are allocated for increasing personnel at the Southwest border to reduce waiting times and combat drug smuggling. Additionally, $230,000,000 in each fiscal year is designated for improving Customs Service facilities at ports of entry on the Southwest Border. Amounts authorized for the United States Customs Service by subsection (a) are additional to any other authorized amounts by law.
